title: The Evolution of Special Effects
description: A quick, practical guide to The Evolution of Special Effects.

buildup.text: Special effects evolved from practical tricks â€” miniatures, matte paintings, stop-motion â€” to digital CGI worlds.

discovery.text: Jurassic Park (1993) was the turning point: animatronics plus CGI proved digital creatures could feel alive.

twist.text: More CGI doesn't mean better films. Mad Max: Fury Road (2015) used mostly practical stunts and won six Oscars.

climax.text: The Volume, LED walls used in The Mandalorian, merges practical and digital. Actors perform inside real-time CGI worlds.

punchline.text: The best effects are the ones you never notice.

quiz.question: What made Jurassic Park a turning point in special effects?
options: It proved digital CGI creatures could look convincingly real alongside practical effects
It was the first film to use any computer graphics
It eliminated the need for practical effects entirely
